column4: Hey, i have a widescreen monitor on my laptop, and i tried to set up a secondary monitor, it didnt work, now my laptop display is all wrong, and i cant change it back
is there a key to change from crt to lcd like fn F4
auctionedllama unfortunatly nvidia is the way to go in linux right now.
ill check,  but i still want my 1440x900 back on my laptop display
if you press that a few times it might work
auctionedllama if you're comfortable with command line backup you xorg.conf and try different drivers in System>Administration>Screens and Graphics
ok Moridin333, that fixed my external monitor issue, now how to i get back to 1440x900 on m;y laptop?
1440x900 is not available, and its not showing my graphics card anymore,a nd i dont know what to select for that, i have an Nvidia Gforce FX 64 mb
if you run the restricted driver manager in System>Administration it should give you the nvidia driver and open up that option.
it says its in use Moridin333
auctionedllama what version are you using?
should i disable it, logout then re enable it?
you can press ctrl alt backspace to restart x
